reviews.review: cured my salt water injecting addiction

There's a brilliant game here but it's buried by a multitude of problems. Half-Life 2 is hailed as a masterpiece by many and it remains one of the most influential and important videogames ever made. However, the game itself is not as impressive as it should be.

You play as theoretical physicist Gordon Freeman. The mysterious G-Man has brought you out of stasis, decades after the Black Mesa incident of the first game. Now, Earth has been taken over by the Combine aliens and they have enslaved humanity. You play a crucial role in the resistance against the alien oppressors.

The game does a good job in creating a sci-fi world that feels about as alive as it could for a game made in 2004. The game also looks visually impressive for the era. Character animations and faces still look great even today. While it's more personal preference, I'm not particularly a fan of the very rusty and battered visual style. It certainly isn't a clean looking future like Star Trek.

The problems come with the gameplay itself. Half-Life 2 offers a mix of FPS action, platforming, physics puzzle and vehicular sections.

The shooting is pretty lacklustre in comparison to games from around the same time such as Halo: Combat Evolved, F.E.A.R. and Call Of Duty 2. You do eventually get the gravity gun, which allows you to pick up various objects and blast them at enemies. It's satisfying when you first get to use it to hurl circular saws and slice enemies in half. However, it does get repetitive after you're forced to do it to what feels like an endless onslaught of enemies. Later on, you get to control giant alien bugs. Again, this gets to a point where it feels repetitive. The worst parts involve using remote turrets to fight off waves of enemies swarming your position. It's just boring.

The game is very start and stop as the action is constantly interrupted by bland platforming and uninspired physics puzzles. The puzzles themselves are not sophisticated enough to be interesting as they usually just involve moving barrels. All they achieve is slowing the game down.

The vehicular stages don't control very well. They're also frequently interrupted by puzzles. It's like as soon as you start picking up some speed, you have to stop to move a few barrels.

Almost every section of the game feels like it goes on too long. There are some wonderful ideas throughout the game but a lot of them overstay their welcome or you never get comfortable with them because of all the interruptions. However, I must confess that some of the chapters near the end (Follow The Freeman and Dark Energy) are significantly better than the rest of the game and help make the game worth playing, it just takes so long to get there. [spoiler]You even end up with an upgraded gravity gun that allows you to hurl enemies.[/spoiler]

The game overall feels way more like a tech demo for the Source engine than a real game. There are so many items you can interact with. Within minutes, you'll have seen more wooden crates in this game than you've ever seen in real-life. Way too much of this game is just you bashing crates with a crowbar.

Some of the enemies are also really annoying. The jumping crab creatures are the worst. Some of the friendly A.I. you get near the end is also annoying as they'll get in your way when you're going through narrow corridors.

With the exception of the vehicle sections, the game does control relatively well. As much as I wish you could aim down the sights, the shooting does at least feel responsive and hit detection works fine. I'm a bit baffled by how the rocket launchers work though as it seems to be random whether or not it locks onto the enemy ships flying above you.

Some of the music is good. However, I disliked that I had to install the soundtrack separately in order to get the background music. I played through the first chapter before I realised there was no music. At least, making it automatically install the soundtrack when you go to install the game. Why would I ever want to play it with it the music?

Another minor complaint I have is that everybody feels the need to say your name all the time. Every time that you interact with anybody, they say your name about 50 times.

While I continue to appreciate Half-Life 2's contributions to the videogame industry, the game itself just isn't all that spectacular. It feels cluttered with terrible pacing. I was also disappointed with the first Half-Life game. Again, it was clearly ground-breaking upon release but it just wasn't all that fun to play.

I'm a huge fan of Valve and their Steam platform. They've done some great games such as Left 4 Dead and Counter Strike: Global Offensive. They're clearly one of the most significant players in the gaming industry and they have always pushed technological boundaries with their work. The fact that people are still demanding Half-Life 3 shows that this game has made a real cultural impact. Half-Life 2 is a work that is to be admired on a technical level but it isn't as fun to actually pick up and play.

I'm giving it an incredibly modest recommendation because some of the final sections of the game are actually enjoyable.

Gameplay: 6/10
Graphics: 8.5/10 (for the time)
Controls: 7.5/10
Replay Value: 3/10

топ игра советую
Плюсы: Потянет даже с видеокартой Интел Графикс 2000, интересные задания и головоломки, на начале можно испугатся и хорошое соотношение ФПС и графики. Играю на максималках, 30-60 фпс. Не считая КСГО с 15 фпс, никогда раньше не играл с такой графикой. VALVE СПАСИБО ВАМ БОЛЬШОЕ Я ХОЧУ ВАМ ОТЛИЗАТЬ ПОПКУ
Минусы: Пугался на начале, иногда было ничего не понятно (куда идти и что делать)
Вывод: Легендарная игра которую обязательно нужно пройти.

Лучшая игра в мире всем советую, это шутер от первого лица с очень интересным сюжетом и графикой, очень удобное управление, если играть с желанием можно понять сюжет, который разделяется аж на несколько игр! Советую всем поиграть не пожалеете, но лучше чтобы лучше вникнуть сюжет скачайте первую часть а потом по очередно проходите, лично я все прошел кроме "Alyx" и "Decay", желаю удачи в прохождении!
Сколько лет этой игре,но она очень крутая)

Prostě skvělé, takto by jsem popsal Half-Life 2. I přesto že hra vyšla v roce 2004 tak má na svou dobu super grafiku ale i přesto jí spustíte skoro na všem. Napínavý příběh který je fakt moc dobře udělaný a hra se s vámi nepáře protože jsou tam části které jsou někdy celkem těžké ale to přece k hrám patří. A za tu cenu to fakt stojí. Tuto hru jsem si velice užil a doporučuji :).
